symptoms: Olive-green or blackish velvety lesions on leaves
causes: Fungal infection caused by Venturia inaequalis
prevention: Remove and destroy infected plant debris

causes: Fungal infection caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

causes: Fungal infection caused by Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae

symptoms: White powdery growth on leaves, stems, and fruit
causes: Fungal infection caused by Podosphaera clandestina or Sphaerotheca pannosa

symptoms: Rectangular gray or tan lesions on leaves
Lesions may join to form larger blotches
causes: Fungal infection caused by Cercospora zeae-maydis or Cercospora sorghi

symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves, husks, and stalks
Yellowing and premature drying of leaves
causes: Fungal infection caused by Puccinia sorghi

symptoms: Long elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves
Lesions may join to form large dead areas
causes: Fungal infection caused by Setosphaeria turcica

symptoms: Shriveled, mummified fruit covered in pustules
causes: Fungal infection caused by Guignardia bidwellii
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: White or yellow spots on leaves
causes: Fungal infection caused by various fungi, including Phaeomoniella chlamydospora
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Lesions may coalesce and cause defoliation
causes: Fungal infection caused by Pseudocercospora vitis
Bacterial infection caused by Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus or africanus
cure: There is no known cure. Removal and destruction of infected trees is recommended.

symptoms: Small, angular spots on leaves and fruit
Spots may coalesce and cause defoliation
causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas arboricola pv. pruni
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit
Spots may turn brown with yellow halos
causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas euvesicatoria or X. vesicatoria
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Lesions may join and cause defoliation
causes: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems
White fuzzy growth on underside of leaves
causes: Fungal-like oomycete infection caused by Phytophthora infestans
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: White, powdery growth on leaves and stems
causes: Fungal infection caused by Sphaerotheca fuliginea or Erysiphe cichoracearum

symptoms: Dark purple or reddish-brown spots on leaves
causes: Fungal infection caused by Diplocarpon earliana
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Small, angular, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit
Spots may turn brown with yellow halos
causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Lesions may join and cause defoliation
causes: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems
White fuzzy growth on underside of leaves
causes: Fungal-like oomycete infection caused by Phytophthora infestans
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Yellow, moldy growth on upper leaf surface
causes: Fungal infection caused by Cladosporium fulvum
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Small, circular spots with gray centers and dark margins on leaves
Lesions may join and cause defoliation
causes: Fungal infection caused by Septoria lycopersici
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

symptoms: Stippled or webbed appearance on leaves
causes: Infestation by two-spotted spider mite (Tetranychus urticae)
prevention: Use insecticidal soap or horticultural oils
cure: Apply appropriate miticides or insecticidal soaps
Remove and destroy heavily infested plant material

symptoms: Brown, circular spots with concentric rings on leaves
Lesions may join and cause defoliation
causes: Fungal infection caused by Corynespora cassiicola
cure: Remove and destroy infected plant material

causes: Viral infection caused by Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus (TYLCV)
cure: There is no cure for viral infections. Removal and destruction of infected plants is recommended.

symptoms: Fruit may develop yellow or green streaks
causes: Viral infection caused by Tomato Mosaic Virus (ToMV)
cure: There is no cure for viral infections. Removal and destruction of infected plants is recommended.
